definition.name: NXroot
definition.doc: Definition of the root NeXus group.

attribute.name: NX_class
attribute.doc: The root of any NeXus data file is an ``NXroot`` class (no other choice is allowed for a valid NeXus data file). This attribute cements that definition.

attribute.name: file_time
attribute.doc: Date and time file was originally created

attribute.name: file_name
attribute.doc: File name of original NeXus file

attribute.name: file_update_time
attribute.doc: Date and time of last file change at close

attribute.name: NeXus_version
attribute.doc:
Version of NeXus API used in writing the file.
Only used when the NAPI has written the file. Note that this is different from the version of the base class or application definition version number.

attribute.name: HDF_version
attribute.doc: Version of HDF (version 4) library used in writing the file

attribute.name: HDF5_Version
attribute.doc:
Version of HDF5 library used in writing the file.
Note this attribute is spelled with uppercase "V", different than other version attributes.

attribute.name: XML_version
attribute.doc: Version of XML support library used in writing the XML file

attribute.name: h5py_version
attribute.doc: Version of h5py Python package used in writing the file

attribute.name: creator
attribute.doc: facility or program where file originated

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which :ref:`NXentry` group contains the data to be shown by default. It is needed to resolve ambiguity when more than one :ref:`NXentry` group exists. The value is the name of the default :ref:`NXentry` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See http://wiki.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data for a summary of the discussion.
